intro: Adinandra schliebenii var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth adinandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves, which are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, often with four to five petals. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
